name: Intro
_source: s;Luther;So it is a dragon after all...{w}{br}To think I'd see one again after all this time.
s;Juliet;You've fought a dragon before, Luther?

s;Luther;Not exactly. {w}{br}It was well known that one did not survive a fight with a dragon.{w}{br}Their fire and claws have left entire batallions in ruins.{w}{br}Their old age also gives them cunning that giants lacked.
s;Luther;While on a hunt, I saw a dragon crest the horizon, and I fled.
s;Juliet;Well, it takes courage to face one now.{w}{br}Think we've got what it takes?
s;Simon;I'm honestly not sure.{w}{br}But after the ridge, I'm worried about those knights.

s;Juliet;Well, if they're not vulnerable to our attacks,{w}{br}they might be hurt by the dragon.{w}{br}Maybe we can get them caught in the crossfire.{w}{br}Then, without its protectors, we stand a better chance against the dragon.
s;Simon;I'm not sure if I share your confidence.{w}{br}This will likely be one of our toughest foes.
s;Johannes;But I've spent years preparing for this moment.
s;Johannes;I must say thank you for clearing out those bandits.{w}{br}With that, I could finally breach this cavern.
s;Johannes;You may call me Johannes, the dragonslayer.
s;Juliet;Quite the ambitious title, dragonslayer.{w}{br}Will this be your first?
s;Johannes;Yet, I have long prepared for this battle.{w}{br}I have forged my blade to pierce dragon scales.{w}{br}And I have studied these caverns and their inhabitants for years.
s;Simon;Well, you seem to know what you're talking about.{w}{br}Care to aid us against the dragon?
speak;Narrator;The dragon will blast fire at certain locations on the map.{w}{br}ANY unit hit by the dragon's fire will take 30 damage.;StyleNid=hint
speak;Narrator;The dragon can also break the MOV tomes.{w}{br}This will bestow the tome's bonus to the enemy forces.;StyleNid=hint
